alert.note: Alert for Charleston (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 10 at 12:07AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast South Carolina, including the following county, Charleston. * WHEN...Until 130 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1203 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 3 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. Motorist within the West Ashley, Johns Island, and James Island may encounter roads with deep ponding of water. Some roads may become impassable or closed due to flood water. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Johns Island, James Island, West Ashley, Downtown Charleston, Fort Sumter, Hollywood, Folly Beach, Ravenel, Kiawah Island, Meggett, Maybank Bridge, James Island County Park, Charles Towne Landing, Fort Johnson, Charleston Executive Airport, Angel Oak Park, Huskum Corner Crosroads, Stono and Legareville.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
